reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: A good value

likes.liked: — Wi-Fi access, good value for $$, clean, spoke English
likes.disliked: — tiny elevator, tiny bathroom, area was almost too quiet

reviews.text: We booked this on a package deal and honestly did not do much research in advance. We were pleased with the property and the staff. The hotel was very clean and mostly quiet. It is good to remember that these 'budget' hotels are also popular with the younger crowd, and we do not fault the property for the large group of noisy German teenagers that took up half our floor on our last night.
reviews.title: Good if you're on a budget!!

reviews.text: We met three different front desk staff members. Each was friendly and spoke English.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel room is small. The bathroom is very small. (this is Europe though) We were disappointed but not surprised to have two single beds pushed together rather than a full size. The window opened for fresh air and we had plenty of hot water. We were in room 404 and our window faced a street. We did not leave the window open at night but did not notice excessive street noise. The elevator is tiny and slow.
reviews.title: Quaint! We liked it!
A bad experience
reviews.text: There was only one plug-in outlet in our entire room and it was in a very inconvenient place if you were trying to blow dry your hair. (you need an adapter for the plug if you are American)

reviews.title: No-Comfort Hotel Lamarck
reviews.text: This ‘budget’ hotel exterior concealed a cramped lobby with cheap plastic chairs & the tear-inducing stench of filthy carpeting, & mold that left us coughing & nauseous.
No baggage storage area, a miniscule elevator & dank, gloomy hallways. Ceilings so low we had to stoop in the dim, sour smelling rooms that made our noses run (dirty carpets again!)
reviews.title: Better than expected

likes.disliked: — no tea or coffee making facility in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the ‘Lilliputian’ sized bathroom a tiny shower stall & a mysterious board secured by wads of paper plugged a huge hole over the toilet! Uncomfortable beds which covered 2/3 of the room forced us to mince crab-like to get to the windows. A broken window sash meant window could not be closed. Pre-booked & fully paid, we could get no refund, upgrade or even get Virgin Vacations to change our hotel!
reviews.title: Great Hotel
worst hotel ever
reviews.text: Despite the friendly English speaking front desk receptionist and fascinating, Montmartre neighborhood, be warned: Comfort Hotel Lamarck is no comfort bargain!

reviews.title: Good location, nice staff, okay room
reviews.text: I was worried about staying in this hotel after reading the reviews (I had booked with Eurostar, and looked at this site afterwards).
The only good thing about this hotel is its location. They have the tiniest rooms in the history of this whole planet.
reviews.title: Great Location, Not so great hotel
Perfec for that break!
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location!! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were small but very comfortable and we found the breakfast buffet to be excellent! This is not a 'posh' hotel but a very comfortable, welcoming place.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Considering the very reasonable price of this hotel, we thought it was all round very satisfactory and will without doubt use it and recommend it!
I think the best thing about this hotel is the location.
reviews.title: Good value for money, very friendly staff
not for claustrophobics
reviews.text: Even with the closest "metro" closed, it has great location. A walk though the nearest streets to the next station (jule Juffen - 500m) is very, very nice. Nice neighborhood, wonderful shops (bakeries, cheese shop, fruit market, fish market…).
Reading a bunch of reviews here, I thought we were in for an acceptable hotel. Staying in Europe for Americans is not cheap, so we settled on this.
reviews.title: A bit small, a bit far, a bit sketchy hood

likes.liked: — Easy access to the Metro to get away

reviews.text: Taking a taxi from our train I almost thought we were not at the right place when the driver stopped. A bunch of thug looking characters were loitering around and I wondered if it was safe to get out of the cab. They tried to put us on the ground floor that looked right at this scene outside and that just wasn't going to work. We heard other travelers unhappy about the ground floor rooms.
reviews.title: acceptable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel: I've traveled enough in Europe to know, hotel rooms are small and Americans do get taken by surprise. Ok, our room couldn't have been any smaller unless they took the bed out. A double room with two people means you're tripping over each other and trying to find a place to stash your luggage so you're not climbing over it. One person can fit in the bathroom at a time.
reviews.title: Worth the Money

likes.liked: — convient and safe location and access to subway

reviews.text: The television... well, I know we didn't travel that far to watch TV, but sometimes after walking for 10 hours a day you need to escape a while and kick back in your room. They were supposed to have BBC and some other channels that weren't "working", so it was down to French channels or German MTV. Unfortunately this made it difficult to figure out what the weather was going to be for the day since there wasn't any news station (not even French.)
reviews.title: Great Location, Clean and Friendly

reviews.text: Our room was clean enough, but there were some holes in the walls (will add candid photos later) and the bed was far form luxury.
reviews.title: clean rooms.
